alert.note: Alert for Central Brewster County; Chinati Mountains; Chisos Basin; Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Eastern Culberson County; Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains; Lower Brewster County; Marfa Plateau; Pecos; Presidio Valley; Reeves County Plains; Terrell; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 29 at 10:15PM CDT until March 30 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM CDT /9 AM MDT/ WEDNESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY LESS THAN 15 PERCENT, 20FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF THE TRANS PECOS... * AFFECTED AREA...Trans Pecos. * TIMING...In effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * WINDS...West 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 12 percent. * RFTI...4 or near critical.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur.
